metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3665 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
System software utilizing Lazy FP state restore technique on systems usingIntel Core-based microprocessors may potentially allow a local process toinfer data from another process through a speculative execution sidechannel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.5').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
